Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows 11 Home, 24H2

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* MoyinShabi is experiencing issues connecting Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.
* The issue started after a recent update.
* MoyinShabi did not receive any health check notifications.

**Problems identified:**

* Issues with the desktop app's database.
* Inability to reproduce the issue consistently.
* Error message related to GetIt flutter package not finding a dependency.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mack-at-pieces requested log files and the "com.pieces.pfd" and "com.pieces.os/Pieces" folders.
* A repaired "com.pieces.pfd" folder was provided.
* A video call was suggested for further troubleshooting.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is not fully resolved. 
* MoyinShabi is experiencing the same issue after replacing the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* A video call is scheduled for further troubleshooting.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue seems related to the GetIt flutter package not finding a dependency. 
* Mack-at-pieces acknowledges the error message in the log file.

**Overall, the issue is ongoing and requires further troubleshooting.**

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* `curl` program is required for downloading and installation of Ollama.
* Pieces-os uses snap packaging with sandboxing, causing `curl` to be unavailable from the sandbox.
* Manually installing Ollama outside the sandbox won't work as Pieces-os cannot access it.

**Problems Identified:**

* Inability to download and install Ollama due to missing `curl`.
* Sandbox constraints in Pieces-os preventing accessing externally installed Ollama.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* Patch for Pieces-os to allow Ollama access within the sandbox.
* Downloading Ollama manually (unresolved as it also impacts inference).
* Infrastructure updates to enable progress on the fix.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The patch is currently in development and expected to be released next week (2025-01-28).
* Users are awaiting the fix and unable to use Ollama within Pieces-os as of today (2023-11-21).

**Other relevant points:**

* Users seeking a temporary solution can access Ollama outside Pieces-os.
* The developers are working on the fix and appreciate the patience from the users.

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are encountering an issue where PiecesOS is running in "basic mode due to device constraints" on their M3 Macs.
* This issue prevents users from accessing the Workstream Activity and seeing updates from the Long Term Memory (LTM) engine.
* The issue seems to be intermittent and difficult to reproduce.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS is incorrectly identifying some M3 Macs as not supporting vector search.
* Users are unable to access Workstream Activity and LTM updates due to basic mode.
* The documentation does not explain "basic mode" or "device constraints."

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Restarting PiecesOS can temporarily resolve the issue.
* A fix for the issue will be included in the next PiecesOS version.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still ongoing for some users.
* A fix is expected in the next PiecesOS version.
* Users are encouraged to report any further issues.

**Additional Notes:**

* The "unknown origin" element in the Pieces App telemetry browser is likely related to a previous installation of PiecesOS.
* The lack of vector search support on M3 Macs is due to a bug in PiecesOS.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.

related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## GitHub Issue Summary

* New user (@bpluly) experienced multiple issues with PiecesOS, including slow performance and boot-up problems.
* User uninstalled the product after a negative first experience.
* Support bot directed user to relevant resources and escalated the issue to the appropriate team.
* Support agent @mark-at-pieces reached out to the user for further investigation and assistance.

**Problems Identified:**

* Long Term Memory feature slows down PC performance.

* New user experience is poor and inconsistent.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support bot provided helpful resources and related issues for user reference.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving launch and connection issues:** The most frequent and active tickets relate to Pieces OS/Desktop app launch failures and connection problems. Focus development resources on identifying and fixing the root causes of these issues.

**Improve LTM engine stability and communication:** Address the issues related to LTM engine activation and vague copilot responses. Ensure clear communication to users about LTM status and expected behavior.

**Enhance Windows compatibility and performance:** Investigate and resolve the disproportionate number of issues reported on Windows, particularly related to launch failures, invalid ports, and slow performance.
**Review antivirus software conflicts:** Address the issue of Kaspersky flagging Pieces OS as a virus and investigate potential conflicts with other antivirus programs.

**Improve communication and documentation:** Provide clearer documentation on troubleshooting common issues, including log file locations and system requirements. Consider adding a section on "basic mode" and its implications.

**Proactively address known issues:**  The "empty message error" was resolved with a patch update. Implement a system for proactively identifying, addressing, and communicating known issues to minimize user disruption.
**Gather detailed system information:** Encourage users to provide detailed system information (OS version, hardware specs, log files) when reporting issues to aid in faster diagnosis and resolution.

**Consider a dedicated Windows support team:** Given the higher volume of Windows-related issues, consider forming a dedicated support team or assigning specific engineers with expertise in Windows environments.
